meanings.definition: a person or thing that centralizes
meanings.sent1: The centralizers in the office always make sure everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent2: The centralizers of the team meetings ensure that everyone stays focused on the agenda.
meanings.sent3: The centralizers of the party were the ones who organized the games and activities.
meanings.sent4: She acted as the centralizers of the family, bringing everyone together during holidays.
meanings.sent5: The centralizers of the project were the key players who coordinated all the tasks.

meanings.definition: a device used to keep something centralized
meanings.sent1: The centralizers placed around the sculpture kept it in the center of the room.
meanings.sent2: The centralizers on the shelf prevented the items from shifting out of place.
meanings.sent3: The centralizers on the table were tiny magnets that held the centerpiece in position.
meanings.sent4: The centralizers in the computer system ensured all data remained in one location.
meanings.sent5: The centralizers in the car engine maintained the alignment of the parts.

meanings.definition: a group or organization that promotes centralization
meanings.sent1: The centralizers in the government aimed to streamline processes for efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The centralizers in the company advocated for a unified approach to decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The centralizers in the school board pushed for standardized policies across all schools.
meanings.sent4: The centralizers in the association worked to consolidate resources for better coordination.
meanings.sent5: The centralizers in the community group focused on bringing all members together for common goals.
